data.title: Vscode become extremely slow with big files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (aa42e6ef8184e8ab20ddaa5682b861bfb6f0b2ad, 2017-09-01T15:25:57.896Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 14.5.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
clarissecomandport|Ben|0.5.0
indenticator|Sir|0.4.2
Bookmarks|ale|0.16.0
project-manager|ale|0.20.0
python|don|0.7.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
datetime|rid|1.0.5
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
trailing-spaces|sha|0.2.11

---
I have a json file with almost 100 000 lines. If I want to edit it inside of VSCode everything becomes slow, the syntax color is not shown at all.
I could understand that if it was the same with sublime text but it's not. Sublime get all these lines easily and everything is as smooth as usual.

data.title: Make bot assign issues to owners with a 1 minute timeout
data.body:
Currently some of our team member (@dbauemer and @jrieken  for example) first create an issue and only then assign it to somebody.
The bot does not seem to cope well with this strategy. Before they could assign it to somebody bot usualy jumps in, adds a debug label and pings me for no reason at all.

Pleae make the bot assign issues with some timeout

data.title: Keytar makes travis build fail if they run extension host tests
data.body:
The problem is that on Travis a machine usually doesn't have `libsecret-1` installed. We should at least document this in the release notes that users know what to do.
```
{ errorCode: 'load',
  moduleId: 'keytar',
  neededBy: [ 'vs/platform/credentials/node/credentialsService' ],
  detail: 
   Error: libsecret-1.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
       at process.module.(anonymous function) [as dlopen] (ELECTRON_ASAR.js:173:20)
       at Object.Module._extensions..node (module.js:598:18)
       at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as .node] (ELECTRON_ASAR.js:173:20)
       at Module.load (module.js:488:32)
       at tryModuleLoad (module.js:447:12)
       at Function.Module._load (module.js:439:3)
       at Module.require (module.js:498:17)
       at n (/home/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/client/lib/.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/loader.js:4:10954)
       at Object.<anonymous> (/home/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/client/lib/.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/node_modules/keytar/lib/keytar.js:1:169)
       at Object.<anonymous> (/home/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/client/lib/.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/node_modules/keytar/lib/keytar.js:55:3) }
```

The fix is to add this to the travis build
```
addons:
  apt:
    packages:
      - libsecret-1-dev
```

data.title: Editor history lost when closing inactive group
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. have 2 files open side by side
2. be in the first file to the left and navigate around (at least 10 lines apart) to produce some editor history
3. navigate back
4. close inactive editor on the right hand side
5. try to navigate forward

=> history is lost after the point where the inactive editor is closed because we wrongly treat that as a editor navigation event

data.title: Ability to name folders in workspace tree.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (c354fca44896da2c9cad82b9bd9126f6658cfae8, 2017-09-08T05:24:34.310Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-svn|eli|0.1.0
tortoise-svn|fan|0.1.1
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-intellisense|fel|1.5.1
composer|ika|0.5.0
smarty|imp|0.2.0
vscode-apache|mrm|1.1.1
wow-bundle|Sep|1.2.4
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a folder to workspace EG: C:\web\server\webroot
2. Add a second folder to workspace EG: C:\web\client\webroot

Without checking the content these two are now identical "wwwroot" folders in the navigator.

Please add something like this to workspace settings:

    {
    	"folders": [
    		{
    			"name": "Server",
    			"path": "C:\web\server\webroot"
    		},
    		{
    			"name": "Client"
    			"path": "C:\web\client\webroot"
    		}
    	]
    }

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Support for choices in Emmet snippets
data.body:
We now have support for choices in snippets via #17545

But these choices don't show up in Emmet snippets. For example the `transform` snippet as defined here: https://github.com/emmetio/snippets/blob/v0.2.5/css.json#L178

data.title: Replacing more than 999+ occurences does not work?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:54:47.289Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---

vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
python|don|0.7.0
terminal|for|0.0.10
elm|sbr|0.15.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Having file like this
```
13
00:03:39,761 --> 00:03:42,179
You don't think he'll ask us how they died?
14
00:03:44,433 --> 00:03:46,225
Get back on your horse.
15
00:03:50,939 --> 00:03:53,441
Whatever did it to them
could do it to us.
16
00:03:53,567 --> 00:03:55,151
They even killed the children.
17
00:03:56,111 --> 00:03:58,112
It's a good thing we're not children.
```
2. CTRL+H with regex
`^[\d:,> -]*$`
3. Got
`1of 999+`
4.Replace all with nothing
5.Does not work

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Linter pep8 and pylint is not installed errors
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.16.0
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra
- Python version: 3.6
- pip: 3
- virtualenv: 3
- extension: https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode/wiki

I am working in a virtualenv, I have my settings.json file like the below:

```
{
  "python.pythonPath": "python",
  "python.linting.pylintEnabled": true,
  "python.linting.pylintPath": "pylint",
  "python.linting.pep8Enabled": true
}
```
I have installed both pylint and pep8 in my virtualenv but keep getting those noisy error alerts in vscode `Linter pep8 is not installed` or `Linter pylint is not installed`, I am using this extension https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode/wiki.

data.title: Better reveal logic
data.body:
The current logic only attempts to reveal the line below the zone widget. This does not guarantee that the zone widget is entirely visible.

The logic in this pr first reveals the line above the zone widget (in the center if not already in the viewport) and then reveals the line below the zone widget.

data.title: Let user to set the mouse keys as keybindings (feature request)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0-ins
- OS Version: win7x64

How about to let user to set mouse keys as keybindings?

For example, people who have the mouse-wheel like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24613274/30194175-3c6122f4-945a-11e7-9f2b-2aa53cf06ab7.png)

would have +2 often used commands in VS Code, bound to these "Shift to the Left" of the wheel, and "Shift to the Right".

And the owners of the mouse like that:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24613274/30194328-2dc80aa4-945b-11e7-9715-70e2dfb1a333.png)

would have +4 (or even 5) more chances to bind all necessary commands to the keys.

(1 theme extensions excluded)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Merge a branch that creates a merge conflict.
2. Resolve the conflicted file
3. Click on + sign to added resolved file to Staged Changes. VS Code will now notify you that you are trying to add a file with a merge conflict to Staged Changes. I just resolved the merge conflict so it shouldn't give me this warning.

All in all, I think the git integration is awesome. Keep it up!

data.title: Syntax highlighting with PHP broken in latest update
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0
- OS Version:  Windows 10 Pro (10.0.15063 Build 15063)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VSCode with latest update and without extensions, use Monokai Color Theme
2. Start a new PHP file with some HTML between PHP tags

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

PHP syntax highlighting is broken for me on latest update (1.16.0). It looks like it thinks the PHP tags are missing or broken i.e the HTML in between should not become purple and the next PHP tag should also not be purple. I have disabled extensions. Reverting back to the previous build works. Screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5327212/30192210-81df44a8-9489-11e7-9a15-3ad0b0bcf1b4.png)

data.title: Document typescript.tsdk_version setting and/or improve typescript.tsdk version detection for development versions of TS
data.body:
The undocumented `typescript.tsdk_version` is currently to set the version of development builds of TS since we cannot determine this automatically. We should improve how TypeScript version is determined and/or create a real documented setting for this

// cc @mhegazy

data.title: Smart Tabs - Feature Request
data.body:
Some editors support what's called "smart tabs." The spec for vscode might look like the following:

>Indentation defined by the nesting of code blocks is made of tabs, while any alignment that follows is made only of spaces.

Conceptually, this would ensure that mixed tabs and spaces for indentation would never occur.

![tabs-vs-spaces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1058243/18036844/49a9426c-6d3b-11e6-98ae-2c9c3db623ae.gif)

[IntelliJ IDEA | Tabs and Indents | Smart Tabs](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/2017.1/code-style-java.html#tabs_and_indents)
_Related discussion: https://github.com/editorconfig/editorconfig/issues/323#issuecomment-327935294_

data.title: Pressing ESC in Bash prompt sometimes prints <M-C-F3>

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm not sure if this is a VS Code or BashOnWindows issue.  I haven't seen it in a regular console window, only the integrated shell in VS Code.

Sometimes, but not most of the time, when I press ESC, the console prints <M-C-F3>.  I normally encounter this in vim when trying to escape insert mode.

https://imgur.com/O1PsWtK

- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:18.034Z)

data.title: Why do I get lightbulbs/refactorings on all quoted strings (among other things)?
data.body:
I seem to get *a lot* of lightbulbs.  For examaple, when I highlight the entire line here why am i getting a refactoring?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/30189265-b3c866c2-93e7-11e7-8ffc-d8c98eeae089.png)

If i put the cursor in the `'docker'` string I get a lightbulb:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/30189322-f24e0bc2-93e7-11e7-9494-38a8ce71840a.png)

I move the cursor to `getConfiguration` and the lightbulb goes away...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/30189333-03ed66e8-93e8-11e7-88b2-d94702219d34.png)

Actually, it looks like no matter where I have a quoted string, I get a lightbulb. Here my cursor is in `"Images"`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/30189358-2bdc7432-93e8-11e7-99b9-70631389ab6f.png)

And when I tell it to refactor my code into a new function, I get this which is technically correct I guess, but not very useful as far as I can tell.

``` TypeScript
    private newFunction(): string {
        return "Images";
    }
```

data.title: Cursor positioning

Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.75
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
xml|Dot|1.9.2
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
format-indent|Kas|1.3.0
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.0
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.9.0

vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11

python|don|0.7.0

CppSnippets|har|0.0.12
rest-client|hum|0.15.2
vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lon|0.2.3
VBScript|lug|0.0.2
MagicPython|mag|1.0.12
Runner|mat|0.1.14
vscode-todo-parser|min|1.9.1
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
prettify-json|moh|0.0.3
Arduino|moo|0.0.4

python|tht|0.2.3
cmake|twx|0.0.17
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1

(3 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set up code to use Courier New as font
2. Add javascript code that contains square or curly braces.
3. Cursor and selection are not painted/displayed at actual position withing a line for positions after the braces; the more braces to bigger the offset.
4. Changing the font to a default one (Droid Sans Mono) solves the problem.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes
